edu.rit.gpu

Class GpuIntMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.GpuVbl
      • edu.rit.gpu.GpuMatrix
        • edu.rit.gpu.GpuIntMatrix

  • public class GpuIntMatrix
extends GpuMatrix
    Class GpuIntMatrix provides an integer matrix GPU variable. This is a two-dimensional array of type int stored in the GPU's memory and mirrored in the CPU's memory.

    Class GpuIntMatrix supports mirroring all of the GPU's data matrix in the CPU's memory, mirroring only a portion of the GPU's data matrix in the CPU's memory, or mirroring none of the GPU's data matrix. Class GpuIntMatrix provides operations for copying all or portions of the data matrix from the CPU to the GPU or from the GPU to the CPU.

    To use an integer matrix GPU variable:

    1. Construct an instance of class GpuIntMatrix by calling the getIntMatrix() method on a Gpu object, specifying the number of rows and columns in the matrix and (optionally) the number of rows and columns in the matrix portion mirrored in the CPU.

    2. Set the item field's elements to the desired values. Call the hostToDev() method to copy the mirrored portion of the matrix from CPU memory to GPU memory.

    3. Pass the GpuIntMatrix object as an argument of a GPU kernel function call. In the GPU code, this becomes a pointer (type int** or unsigned int**) to an array of R row pointers, where R is the number of rows in the matrix; each row pointer points to an array of C data elements, where C is the number of columns in the matrix. The GPU code sets the matrix's elements to the desired values.

    4. Call the devToHost() method to copy the mirrored portion of the matrix from GPU memory to CPU memory. Examine the values of the item field's elements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int[][] item
      The mirrored portion of the integer matrix in CPU memory.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void devToHost(int dstrow, int dstcol, int srcrow, int srccol, int rowlen, int collen)
      Copy the given portion of this GPU matrix from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory.
      void hostToDev(int dstrow, int dstcol, int srcrow, int srccol, int rowlen, int collen)
      Copy the given portion of this GPU matrix from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory.

    • Method Detail

      • hostToDev

        public void hostToDev(int dstrow,
             int dstcol,
             int srcrow,
             int srccol,
             int rowlen,
             int collen)
        Copy the given portion of this GPU matrix from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory. rowlen×collen elements starting at indexes [srcrow][srccol] in the CPU matrix are copied to the GPU matrix starting at indexes [dstrow][dstcol].
        Specified by:
        hostToDev in class GpuMatrix
        Parameters:
        dstrow - GPU matrix starting row index.
        dstcol - GPU matrix starting column index.
        srcrow - CPU matrix starting row index.
        srccol - CPU matrix starting column index.
        rowlen - Number of rows to copy.
        collen - Number of columns to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dstrow < 0, dstcol < 0, srcrow < 0, srccol < 0, rowlen < 0, collen < 0, dstrow+rowlen > rows(), dstcol+collen > cols(), srcrow+rowlen > cpuRows(), or srccol+collen > cpuCols().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • devToHost

        public void devToHost(int dstrow,
             int dstcol,
             int srcrow,
             int srccol,
             int rowlen,
             int collen)
        Copy the given portion of this GPU matrix from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory. rowlen×collen elements starting at indexes [srcrow][srccol] in the GPU matrix are copied to the CPU matrix starting at indexes [dstrow][dstcol].
        Specified by:
        devToHost in class GpuMatrix
        Parameters:
        dstrow - CPU matrix starting row index.
        dstcol - CPU matrix starting column index.
        srcrow - GPU matrix starting row index.
        srccol - GPU matrix starting column index.
        rowlen - Number of rows to copy.
        collen - Number of columns to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dstrow < 0, dstcol < 0, srcrow < 0, srccol < 0, rowlen < 0, collen < 0, dstrow+rowlen > cpuRows(), dstcol+collen > cpuCols(), srcrow+rowlen > rows(), or srccol+collen > cols().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
